title: The Old Vegetable Neurotics, Hemlock, Opium, Belladonna and Henbane: Their Physiological Action and Therapeutical Use Alone and in Combination, Being the Gulstonian Lectures of 1868, Extended
description: Excerpt from The Old Vegetable Neurotics, Hemlock, Opium, Belladonna and Henbane: Their Physiological Action and Therapeutical Use Alone and in Combination, Being the Gulstonian Lectures of 1868, Extended and Including a Complete Examination of the Active Constituents of Opium My object throughout has been to ascertain, clearly and definitely, the action of. The drugs employed on the healthy body in medicinal doses, from the smallest to the largest to deduce simple practical conclusions from the facts observed; and then to apply the drug to the relief of the particular conditions to which its action appeared suited.
author: John Harley
